abstract.text: Exports one or more certificates, keys, or identities.

inlineContent.text: The keychain item or items to export. You can export only the following types of keychain items:
, and
. If you are exporting exactly one item, you can specify a
object. Otherwise this parameter is a
object containing a number of items of type
The format of the desired external representation for the item. Set this parameter to
to use the default for that item type. Possible values for this parameter and default values are enumerated in

A flag field indicating whether the exported item should have PEM armor. PEM armor refers to a way of expressing binary data as an ASCII string so that it can be transferred over text-only channels such as email. Set this flag to
if you want PEM armoring.
A pointer to a structure containing a set of input parameters for the function. If no key items are being exported, these parameters are optional and you can set the
parameter to
. For more information, see
On return, the variable referenced by this argument is overwritten with a
object containing the external representation of the keychain item or items. You are responsible for releasing this object by calling
A result code. See

This function works only with keys, certificates, and identities. An identity is the combination of a certificate and its associated private key. Although public keys are commonly stored in certificates, they can be stored separately in the keychain as well; for example, when you call the
function to create a key pair, both the public and private keys are stored in the keychain. Use the
function to find a key or certificate. Use the
function in the Certificate, Key, and Trust API to find an identity.

abstract.text: Releases a Core Foundation object.
A reference to an immutable array object.
A reference to an immutable CFData object.
Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.
An abstract Core Foundation-type object representing an X.509 certificate.
The external format of a keychain item.
An abstract Core Foundation-type object representing an identity.
Finds the next identity matching specified search criteria
Exports one or more certificates, keys, or identities.
The import and export function flags.
A flag that indicates the exported data should have PEM armor.
The import/export parameter structure.
An object that represents a cryptographic key.
Creates an asymmetric key pair and stores it in a keychain.
An opaque type that represents a keychain item.
Finds the next keychain item matching the given search criteria.
Evaluate result codes common to many Security framework functions.
A reference to an immutable CFData object.
An untyped "generic" reference to any Core Foundation object.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
